DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy IMRT External Beam Radiation Therapy Administration Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of radiation therapy administered, an advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy or radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy IMRT External Beam Radiation Therapy Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of an advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy or radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredName: IMRT External Beam Radiation Therapy Administration
Property.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy:(ray-dee-AY-shun) Radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.
Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Radiation Therapy IMRT External Beam Radiation Therapy Administration Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of Radiation Therapy being administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Will the patient receive stan
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient receive standard 4-field External Beam Radiotherapy or Intensity Modulated Radiation Therapy (IMRT)?
